content.question:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The images show a view of the exterior and interior of the Taj Mahal, built in Agra, India, c. 1632–1653 C.E.

Describe at least one visual characteristic of the Taj Mahal.

Describe the specific function of the Taj Mahal.

Using at least two specific examples of contextual evidence, explain how the function influenced the design of the Taj Mahal.

Using specific evidence, explain why the design of the Taj Mahal can be interpreted as a representation of paradise.
